Namespace Microsoft.SupplyChain.Utilities

Classes

DeferredInvocation

Delta

Delta represents the comparison of differences between all the property values of two objects (left, right) of the same type. Delta's PropertyDelta tree is pruned when the left and right property values are deep identical. When pruned, the PropertyDelta will still appear in the parent Delta PropertyDeltas list with the IsLeftAndRightTheSame == true. However, any Delta with IsLeftAndRightTheSame == true will not have any PropertyDeltas of its own.

DeltaIgnoreAttribute

DeltaResolver

DeltaResolver exists to calculate the difference between two hierarchical object graphs rooted by the left and right parameters of the Resolve method It does not by itself do anything with the Delta it calculates and returns from the Resolve method. It is intended to be used in conjunction with classes such as DeltaRecorder and DeltaRestorer. Notice that it exists in the Extensions namespace because is has no dependencies on the definitions of the input classes. However, it may be necessary to provide your own IsEqualsStrategy instead of the default IsEquals method to adapt to your libraries design patterns for identity.

ElementCondition

ElementCondition is a strategy to remove elements within the Json that meet a condition. The Path property identifies where within the Json the conditional element will appear. By default, MatchPathExactly is false which means an element need only match the end of the elements full path. For example, an element at path Foo.Bar.Wak would match a path "Bar.Wak" which allows for Bar.Wak's to be found scattered throughout the structure If MatchPathExactly is set to true then Foo.Bar.Wak would only be matched by the full path of "Foo.Bar.Wak". Diferent types of conditions are created by different classes that derive from the abstract ElementCondition class (strategy pattern).

InvokeAttribute

IsValueTypeAttribute

Json

KnownTypesBinder

ListDelta

ListDelta represents the comparison of two lists of the same type.

ListElementDelta

ListElementDelta represents the comparison of one list element between two lists (left, right) of the same type. Only one of the properties (LeftOnlyElement, RightOnlyElement, ExistsInBothDelta) should be non-null depending on which of the lists contains the element.

MapContext

MappingMethod

MappingMethodGroup

MatchAttribute

MatchPair

MatchStack

The MatchStack is similar to a call stack created by a compiler.
ModelMapper.Map_Recur is a recursive call where the "to" object is instantiated with values of the "from" object At each level in the call stack, MatchStack tracks the two objects (to and from) being mapped. The MatchStack is primarily used by MappingMethods attempting to map objects that are not matched to them in the recursion. These MappingMethods can use the MapContext.MatchStack parameter passed to them to locate other contextual objects they need to perform the map.

MatchTypeAttribute

MatchTypes

MatchUnavailableWhemMappingFromCartographerAttribute

ModelMapper

ModelMapperIgnoreAttribute

PropertyDelta

PropertyDelta represents the comparison of the same property on two objects of the same type Only one of the properties ValueDelta or ListElementDeltas will have values depending on whether the property is a list (IsList) or single valued

ReflectionHelper

RemoveElementWithValue

RemoveElementWithValue is an ElmeentCondition that removes elements whose value matches any of the values provided.
